page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The City and District of St. Albans was named after the first Christian martyr, St. Alban. St. Albans is the largest of Hertfordshire's{10 Districts. St. Albans has a population of{128,000.}It covers an area of{63 square miles. Our area covers{12 square kilometres. It starts from Camp Road near to St. Alban and St. Stephen's RC School. It stretches to Smallford Lane near Colney Heath, then through the edge of Colney Heath to Tyttenhanger Green, then back through London Colney and on to Camp Road again. The{A6}and the{A405}are in our area. The whole area is mostly fields, with farms, woodland and gravel pits. The Camp area and London Colney are like small villages in the St. Albans area. In the area there are{4}mental hospitals and{7}state schools.
